title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For a correctly drawn velocity vector, directed along the horizontal line, either to the right or the left

1 point is earned: For the correctly drawn acceleration vector, directed upward along the string

Vectors must be labeled, and have an arrowhead to show their direction

(ii)

1 point is earned: For indicating that the velocity is zero

2 points are earned: For the correctly drawn acceleration vector, pointing down and to the left, perpendicular to the string

One of these points was awarded if the vector was in the proper quadrant, not perpendicular to the string, and not on either the vertical or horizontal lines

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For indicating that the path is initially horizontal (via figure or words)

1 point is earned: For indicating that the horizontal velocity is constant

1 point is earned: For indicating that the vertical motion is under constant acceleration or free-fall

The last two points were also awarded for describing the path as a parabola, or indicating that the ball is a projectile

A maximum of 2 points were awarded for a correct figure with no description or a correct description with no path drawn on the figure

(ii)

1 point is earned: For correctly indicating that the ball falls straight down

1 point is earned: For indicating that the vertical motion is under constant acceleration or free-fall

A maximum of 1 point was awarded for a correct figure with no description a correct description with no path drawn on the figure
